projects.title: Boost
projects.desc:
Boost is a non-profit corporation with the goal of creating integrated strategies in order to insure continuous alignment between workers and their jobs in order to unlock the value in people. With a focus on solving the reoccurring issues surrounding the crisis’ that stem from technological advancements in the workplace. These are things like the automation crisis, the rapid evolution within industries, the skills gap which can cause large amounts of inequality both in terms of skills and critical earnings, the identity crisis that comes with losing a persons career, and the fact that our future is unknown leaving our future uncertain and under planned.

Boost does this through utilizing the boost method which focus on innovation for evolvability, education in order to create a more equal distribution of skills in the workplace and human needs in order to empathize and advocate for the workers needs throughout their careers. This will allow companies to focus on the final component which is the work that is critical to the future to ensure the economic stability of people in order to unlock their value.

projects.title: Meliorise
projects.desc: Meliorise is a pilot plan to facilitate the discussion of intensifying neighbourhoods and to unlock value in existing land, creating healthy neighbourhoods. Healthy neighbourhoods include a variety of housing choices and the accessibility and opportunities brought by complete communities. We aim to change perceptions about the benefits of density in our neighbourhoods.

projects.title: InPlace
projects.desc:
In Place project is about expanding land holding for public good, creating additional rental; units and gently density of neighbourhood and give the user control to age in place yet giving them opportunity to unlock capital in looked/future assets.

In-Place aims to empower community hubs to unlock more land and apartments in the public good, and allow residents to age-in place. Holding land in the public good allows the community to remain in place and protects this complete community, leading to a healthy mix of tenures, incomes, services, businesses, shops, opportunities and people, ultimately creating an affordable neighbourhood that benefits all.

We used West Neighbourhood House(WNH) as a case study to study the In-Place model to work best for any community hubs.

This program allows the senior to age in place, staying in their home longer not only because some capital is unlocked monthly for them, but also because the home is renovated and maintained to a higher standard. WNH stands to generate some revenue, which they can reinvest in the program, while also maintaining or further densifying the area with new rental units.

projects.title: Exhibition
projects.desc:
This exhibition is the culmination of a year long research into the causes and factors of unaffordability around the world and in the Toronto Region. This exhibition aims to challenge our current perceptions of value and propose alternative affordable solutions by unlocking existing assets and resources.

Date

May 30th, 2019. 6-8pm

Location

3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, ON

projects.title: More Information
projects.desc:
Who are we?

This year’s cohort of the ​Institute without Boundaries​ (IwB) is comprised of eight women, among whom are two international students from India. Another student was born in Mauritius, and one is from El Salvador. One is a recent immigrant from Iran and is now a Permanent Resident in Canada. Five are women of colour. Our backgrounds and skill sets cover a huge range, making for important learning and collaboration from one another. Collectively, we’ve lived in Mumbai, Hong Kong, rural Ontario, Bucheon, the Kingdom of Bahrain, Dubai, Bangalore, Calgary, Isfahan, Nottingham, San Salvador and now Toronto. Just amongst ourselves, we bring to the table many perspectives on affordability.

Why a quiz?

We want to challenge your perceptions of Affordability. There are lot’s of solutions for Affordability, but our perceptions of Affordability as a monetary solution alone are holding us back. The system we’ve designed is limiting choices. Connected to our larger strategies of the ways in which we undervalue and overvalue. We undervalue choice, people! and overvalue merit, capital.

We hope

We hope that this quiz and the overall experience of our coming exhibition sparks a dialogue, deepens and challenges your understanding of affordability and most importantly, inspires you to take action with the realization that our perspectives and values are fundamental to achieving a more equitable future.

outcomes.title: builder
outcomes.desc: when it comes to affordability, you see future possibilities and actively aim for change.
outcomes.explore: Meliorise is a project that unlocks value in existing space with a clever approach to thinking about density and improving neighbourhoods.  Taking advantages of existing resources, MelioRise strives to make communities inclusive, accessible and affordable.

outcomes.title: realist
outcomes.desc: when it comes to affordability, you look at things in a pragmatic way. You are not easily fooled and think in a logical manner. You aren't affected by bias and ideologies.
outcomes.explore: InPlace is a project that unlocks value in existing capital, and allows individuals to age in place. Based on research and grounded in reality, InPlace is a feasible strategy to tackle some elements of affordability.

outcomes.title: seeker
outcomes.desc: when it comes to affordability, you envision change and your main motivator is to empower the people around you.
outcomes.explore: Boost is a project that unlocks value in people through the creation of a continuism aligment between workers and their jobs, making work meaningful in the face of future worker displacement.
